posts.message:
[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/nQVBjx1.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1999047][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Headlines/Vitani.png[/img][/url][/align]
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium][b][color=white]Vast changes incoming[/color][/b]
Yesterday, October 20th, our administrator [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] announced that big changes will be made to Hack Forums in the upcoming week. Because of this you may expect the website to be offline a lot, either as closed or simply returning a 403 error. More information about the specific changes that are going to be happening will undoubtedly follow in the near future.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5741003] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Thread EDIT restriction removed[/color][/b]
As many of you might already know, for a brief period [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] added restrictions to the thread EDIT feature. The reason behind this was simply to end the continues thread EDIT abuse by members every day. Thread abuse was done by deleting content from older threads to "erase footprints" or for other reasons, which hurt Hack Forums SEO. The restriction prevented members from editing their threads if it was older then a set amount of days. Yesterday however, [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] decided to lift the restriction again, after which several major changes to the website followed. You can read more about those below.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5740228] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Mentor site group deleted[/color][/b]
Last night our administrator [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] made a thread in the Rules, Announcements, News and Feedback section stating the mentor group had been deleted. No specific reason has been given for this change at this time.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5740970] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Hack Forums IM Deleted[/color][/b]
Yesterday night we were notified by [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] that he would be deleting the Hack Forums IM service. This is the xmpp service that was specifically designed to be used for instant communication between HF members. No specific reason has been given for removing this service although it was known that the service itself was rarely used within the community. The newly launched hacker.im service, which is a public xmpp service for HF users and others alike, will still continue to exist.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5740972] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Forum Tabs Deleted[/color][/b]
Among the changes that were made last night by our admin [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] was the removal of the forum tabs. Omniscient made a thread saying "We will no longer have the tabs on HF". [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5740974]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[list][b][color=#d2ffcc]Update[/color][/b]
In response to a member's question asking if tabs will return, Omni posted: "Nope, it's gone. Just like my addition of tabs to HF being innovative to forums and MyBB I have better ideas for index and forum navigation. Ideas which are mobile friendly and modern." Sounds like we'll be getting something better than tabs that work well for mobile and please everything like tabs did.
[/list]

[b][color=white]Purple HF Theme Deleted[/color][/b]
Another change that was made yesterday was the removal of the Purple Theme option. Many users used this theme as they preferred it over the standard "Modern Blue" theme. For now we don't know if we will be getting another new or possibly revamped theme in the future however we do know [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] had a liking to the widely used "Flat Darkness" theme made by [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][b][color=#FFFFFF]iHydra[/color][/b][/url][i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5740975] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]UB3R Support and Meme Shit Meme sections Deleted[/color][/b]
Yet another change that was made in recent days is the deletion of the UB3R Support and Meme Shit Meme sections. No reason has been given for the removal of both sections however it's safe to assume they were removed as one of the changes [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] had in mind for the new HF.

[b][color=white]All Non-Essential Moderators Removed[/color][/b]
In light of recent changes all non-essential moderators have been removed. This includes but is not limited to (sub)forum moderators and site groups with special permissions such as the mentors group. In the thread where [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] announced this change, he also mentioned he will consider new moderators and other options as we go forward. Furthermore he said "We need a clean slate on a lot of HF.". [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5741357]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]HF Writers Group and Wiki Deleted[/color][/b]
The final change we will report in this weeks news edition is the removal of the HF Writers group along with the HF Wiki. Both the group and the wiki have been deleted by [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] and are said to be done for. As this is a major change for the very news and the people behind it, we would like to make it known that even without the group we will continue to bring the news to you each and every week. This of course assuming we have the permission to keep doing so by the administrator.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5740983] >>Source[/url][/size][/i][/size][/font]

posts.subject: RE: Hack Forums News // Edition 366

posts.message:
[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Memo.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Welcome to MyBB 1.8x[/color][/b]
Let me first say that I'm very excited with what the future of Hack Forums entails. MyBB 1.8x opens the oppurtunity for more custom features to be created by Omniscient. We got cool features like the ability to add a poll to a thread within 12 hours of posting the thread and edit reason but the features Omniscient can create now that MyBB 1.8x brought a better (but still buggy) foundation to work with is what everyone should be excited for.

However, we should also understand that the forum is still under development. Lots of work needs to be done and it'll take 1-2 weeks or so according to Omni so let's try our best not to bother him too much. I keep seeing the same threads over and over: quit it. We don't need 20 threads talking about how shit or awesome the theme is or how we want the ability to add avatars.

[b][color=white]Future of Writ3rs[/color][/b]
Many of you have raised the question if Writ3rs is returning. No clue, I'm in the same darkness you all are. Omniscient will decide eventually. What I do know is that Writ3rs won't continue unofficially. The work we do, the hours we volunteer, it just wouldn't work efficiently enough without a subforum for us to privately post our sections in. No, pastebin and Discord isn't enough. If Writ3rs isn't back by this coming Monday, expect another short edition until the ruling has been revealed. Till then, shoutout to all the members who worked on this edition and to those who support us every week.

[color=transparent]   [/color]
